text:
This topic has come up for me a couple times and I think will come up more frequently as the community grows and more packages are being registered. It is getting more difficult to name packages.

In my case, I have a bunch of finance-related packages with common names and I don't want to preface each name with "Financial". That is a non-starter for me. For example,

• Assets.jl
• Positions.jl
• Instruments.jl
I've proposed the use of namespaces to solve this problem so we can do things like

```pkg> add JuliaFinance/Assets```
but that requires some non-trivial (but totally doable) changes to the way Julia handles packages.

On Zulip, we came up with an alternative that requires no change to the current system.

What if I register one package `JuliaFinance`  for the entire organization and then the various packages are subdirectories? In this way, we can simply do

```pkg> add JuliaFinance.Assets```
and my issues disappear.

Would this be acceptable for General?
